title: Configure Fly.io Deployment
description: Create a fly.toml configuration for a Serverpod backend with health checks and auto-scaling.
instructions:
Complete the fly.toml configuration file for deploying a Serverpod backend to Fly.io. The configuration should:

1. Set the app name to 'my-flutter-backend'
2. Use 'sjc' (San Jose) as the primary region
3. Configure the HTTP service on port 8080 with HTTPS enforcement
4. Add a health check that hits '/health' every 15 seconds
5. Configure auto-scaling with minimum 1 machine running
6. Set VM resources to 1 shared CPU and 512MB memory
hints: The app name must be globally unique on Fly.io - use lowercase and hyphens
Health check interval is in milliseconds - 15 seconds = 15000ms
For Serverpod, use the standard /health endpoint that returns a 200 OK response
Use 'shared' cpu_kind for cost-effective deployments, 'dedicated' for production workloads
